intro: Galatella dahurica f. yamatsutana, commonly known as the Yamatsutana bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lanceolate leaves that are hairy on the underside. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded forest environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in horticulture.
